docs.lead_paragraph: DO parents, in buying toys for their little ones, guide their choice not by what the children will like, but by what they like themselves?

headline.main: CRITICIZES PARENTAL CHOICE OF PLAYTHINGS FOR CHILDREN; Fathers and Mothers, Buying Toys, Will Often Please Themselves and Disregard Needs of Little Folk, Says Kindergarten Expert

docs.abstract: Criticism of poorly selected toys quoted in sp art by Ethel W Everett
docs.snippet: DO parents, in buying toys for their little ones, guide their choice not by what the children will like, but by what they like themselves?

docs.lead_paragraph: STATISTICS show many things, as radio lecture fans will grant, and no doubt the bare number of talented young people who seek opportunities in New York is recorded. Mr. Barretto's thoughtful novel illumines the life many of them presumably have left, the conditions they find in the new "Babylon" and the processes by which they are assimilated.

headline.main: Spring Is Not Far Behind in the Flow of New Novels; TO BABYLON. By Larry Barretto. 322 pp. Boston: Little. Brown & Co. $2. Latest Works of Fiction Latest Works of Fiction Latest Works of Fiction
